messages.title: The strong voice Cambridge needs...
messages.content: Bookies and pundits have confirmed that the election here in Cambridge will be very close between popular Lib Dem Julian Hupert and Jeremy Corbyn's Labour candidate.
Your vote could make all the difference - TIGHT TWO-HORSE RACE EXPECTED

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposing an extreme UKIP-style Brexit to protect jobs and ensure our local businesses and universities get the support they need.
Giving our underfunded NHS and social care an extra £6 billion each year to help boost services, including mental healthcare.
An extra £7 billion for schools to help ensure our children receive the first-class education they deserve.

mentions.candidate: Bookies and pundits have confirmed that the election here in Cambridge will be very close between popular Lib Dem Julian Hupert and Jeremy Corbyn's Labour candidate.
mentions.tacticalSituation: It's going to be close - It's Julian or Labour in Cambridge

issues.brexitEurope: Opposing an extreme UKIP-style Brexit to protect jobs and ensure our local businesses and universities get the support they need.
issues.education: An extra £7 billion for schools to help ensure our children receive the first-class education they deserve.
issues.health: Giving our underfunded NHS and social care an extra £6 billion each year to help boost services, including mental healthcare.

quotes.text: Your vote could make all the difference - TIGHT TWO-HORSE RACE EXPECTED

leaflet.additionalNotes: Just 599 votes separated Julian Huppert and Labour back in 2015. The Conservatives finished a very distant third and cannot compete here.
